properties.name: 12th Street Bridge
properties.status: Open to traffic; two lanes; one way southbound

properties.name: 13th Street Bridge
properties.status: Open to traffic; two lanes; one way northbound

properties.name: Ambridge-Woodlawn Bridge
properties.history: Built 1927 by the American Bridge Co.

properties.name: Big Four Bridge
properties.history: Originally built 1895 by the Louisville & Jefferson Bridge Co. Bought by Cleveland; Cincinnati; Chicago Railroad after construction. Rebuilt 1929 using existing stone piers. Approches scrapped 1974.

properties.name: Big Mac Bridge
properties.status: Open to eight total lanes of traffic
properties.history: Constructed started 1971; opened to limited traffic 1977; dedicated 1981; entire I-471 project completed 1985

properties.name: Central Bridge
properties.history: Built 1891 by the King Bridge Co.; demolished using explosives in 1992

properties.name: CN - Metropolis Bridge
properties.history: Built 1917 by the American Bridge Co. under the direction of engineers C. H. Cartlidge and Ralph Modjeski

properties.name: CNTP Ohio River Bridge
properties.history: Built 1922 using the existing piers from a 1877 bridge

properties.name: CSX Ohio River Bridge
properties.history: Crosses Ohio River between Parkersburg; WV; and Belpre; OH. Constructed between 1868-1870 by B&O; railroad. Longest in world upon completion at 7140 feet.

properties.name: First Cairo Railroad Bridge
properties.status: Replaced by the current bridge; reusing many of the piers in the process
properties.history: Built 1889 under engineer George S. Morison; replaced 1949-52

properties.name: First Cincinnati Southern Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1869-1877; superstructure replaced by current bridge in 1922

properties.name: First Henderson Bridge
properties.history: Built 1885; replaced by the current railroad bridge just to the south

properties.name: Fort Steuben Bridge
properties.history: Built 1928 by the Dravo Contracting Co.; rehabilitated 1972; closed 2008. Imploded Feb. 21; 2012.

properties.name: George Rogers Clark Memorial Bridge
properties.history: Built 1929 by the American Bridge Co.; tolls removed 1946; rehabilitated 1958

properties.name: Henderson Bridge
properties.history: Built 1932 by the American Bridge Co. ; replacing an earlier 1885 bridge

properties.name: Ironton-Russell Bridge
properties.history: Built 1922; owned by the Kentucky State Highway Department

properties.name: John F. Kennedy Memorial Bridge
properties.history: Built 1963 by the Allied Structural Steel Company

properties.name: K&TI; - Ohio River Bridge
properties.status: Open to railroad traffic; southbound vehicle lane open to railroad employees; and the prospect of full scale vehicle use of bridge is in the works due to closeure of the Sherman Minton Bridge
properties.history: First bridge built 1886; reconstructed 1912; road deck partially collapsed and closed to northbound traffic. Company employees can use southbound lane.

properties.name: LIRC - Falls of the Ohio Bridge
properties.history: Built in 1867-70 for the Louisville & Nashville and the Jeffersonville; Madison and Indianapolis Railroad; reconstructed in 1919

properties.name: Market Street Bridge
properties.history: Built 1905 by the Ohio Steel Erection Company; rehabilitated 1981 and 2011

properties.name: New Madison-Milton Bridge
properties.history: Opened to traffic on April 17; 2014 after being slid onto it's permanent piers a week prior.

properties.name: New U.S. Grant Cable-Stayed Suspension Bridge
properties.history: Cable stayed suspension bridge replaced earlier true wire suspension bridge at same location. Construction started 25 June 2001 and finished 16 October 2006 at a cost of $28;434;495.93

properties.name: Paducah Bridge
properties.status: Open to four lanes of traffic

properties.name: Parkersburg Suspension Bridge
properties.history: Built 1916; Demolished 1980; Replaced by the Parkersburg-Belpre Bridge

properties.name: Pike Island Lock and Dam
properties.history: Built between 1959 and 1965 to replace Locks & Dams 10 and 11

properties.name: Purple People Bridge
properties.history: First built 1872 as a Whipple through truss bridge; reconstructed 1897; railroad service discontinued 1987; closed to road traffic 2001; rehabilitated and reopened to pedestrians 2003

properties.name: Roebling Suspension Bridge
properties.history: Built 1866 by John A. Roebling. Rehabilitated 1955.

properties.name: Sciotoville Bridge
properties.history: Built 1914-17 under the direction of Gustav Lindenthal; opened to railroad traffic July 31; 1917

properties.name: Sherman Minton Bridge
properties.status: Reopend on Feb 18th after being Closed by order of Gov. Mitch Daniels after inspections found crack in a load bearing portion of the structure.

properties.name: Silver Bridge
properties.status: Collapsed and replaced by new bridge
properties.history: Built 1928; collasped on December 15; 1967; killing 46 people. Replaced by a new bridge in 1969.

properties.name: Simon Kenton Memorial Bridge
properties.history: Built 1931; Bypassed by the cable-stayed William H. Harsha Bridge in 2000; rehabed in 2003-2004

properties.name: Taylor-Southgate Bridge
properties.history: Built in 1995 to replace the old Central Bridge

properties.name: WE - Ohio River Bridge (Bellaire)
properties.history: Built 1871; Ohio River truss spans replaced 1905 by the American Bridge Co.

properties.name: Wheeling Suspension Bridge
properties.history: Built 1849; collapsed May 17; 1854; temporary bridge reopened July 26; 1854; permanent bridge reopened July 1860; improvements made 1871-72; 1886; 1922; 1930; 1956 and other years
